00040 namespace boost {
00041 namespace xint {
00042 namespace detail {
00043 
00044 BOOST_XINT_INLINE void random_by_size(data_t& target, base_random_generator&
00045     gen, size_t bits, bool high_bit_on, bool low_bit_on, bool can_be_negative)
00046 {
00047     if (bits == 0) { target.set(0); return; }
00048 
00049     // Grab a bunch of bits
00050     bitqueue_t bitqueue;
00051     while (bitqueue.size() < bits) bitqueue.push(gen(),
00052         std::numeric_limits<base_random_generator::result_type>::digits);
00053 
00054     // Stick them into an integer
00055     size_t d = data_t::bits_to_digits(bits);
00056     target.beginmod(d);
00057     digit_t *tdigits = target.digits();
00058     target.length = (std::min)(d + 1, target.max_length());
00059     digit_t *pp = tdigits, *ppe = pp + target.length;
00060     while (pp < ppe) *pp++ = static_cast<digit_t>(bitqueue.pop(bits_per_digit));
00061 
00062     // Trim it to the proper length
00063     size_t index = (bits / bits_per_digit);
00064     digit_t mask = (digit_t(1) << (bits % bits_per_digit)) - 1;
00065     if (mask == 0) { mask = digit_mask; --index; }
00066     target.length = index + 1;
00067     tdigits[index] &= mask;
00068     for (digit_t *i = tdigits + index + 1, *ie = tdigits + target.length; i <
00069         ie; ++i) *i = 0;
00070 
00071     if (high_bit_on) setbit(target, bits - 1);
00072     if (low_bit_on) setbit(target, 0);
00073     target.negative = (can_be_negative && (gen() & 0x01));
00074     target.endmod();
00075 }
00076 
00077 } // namespace detail
00078 } // namespace xint
00079 } // namespace boost
00081 
00083 // The secure random generator
00084 
00086 namespace boost {
00087 namespace xint {
00088 namespace detail {
00089 
00090 #ifdef _WIN32
00091     template <typename T>
00092     struct strong_random_generator_t<T>::impl_t {
00093         typedef BOOLEAN (WINAPI *RtlGenRandomFn)(PVOID, ULONG);
00094         typedef DWORD result_type;
00095 
00096         impl_t(): dll(0), fn(0) {
00097             // This should work under WinXP, Vista, and Win7. No guarantees
00098             // about future compatibility, but I doubt that Microsoft will get
00099             // rid of it (it's too useful), and I doubt that they'll change it
00100             // now that it's well-known (it would break too many programs). We
00101             // could also use the rand_s function in more recent versions of
00102             // Visual C++, but that causes compatibility problems with older
00103             // versions of Windows.
00104             dll=LoadLibraryA("Advapi32.dll");
00105             if (dll != 0) fn=RtlGenRandomFn(GetProcAddress(dll,
00106                 "SystemFunction036"));
00107             if (fn == 0) {
00108                 destroy();
00109                 throw exceptions::no_strong_random();
00110             }
00111         }
00112 
00113         ~impl_t() { destroy(); }
00114 
00115         result_type operator()() {
00116             result_type r=0;
00117             if (!fn(&r, sizeof(result_type)))
00118                 throw exceptions::no_strong_random("RtlGenRandom failed");
00119             return r;
00120         }
00121 
00122         void destroy() { if (dll) FreeLibrary(dll); }
00123 
00124         HMODULE dll;
00125         RtlGenRandomFn fn;
00126     };
00127 
00128     template <typename T>
00129     BOOST_XINT_INLINE double strong_random_generator_t<T>::entropy() const
00130         { return 32; }
00131 #else
00132     template <typename T>
00133     struct strong_random_generator_t<T>::impl_t {
00134         typedef unsigned char result_type;
00135 
00136         impl_t(): rng("/dev/urandom", std::ios::binary) {
00137             // This should be supported under most non-Windows systems. Note
00138             // that we're using /dev/urandom, not /dev/random -- /dev/random is
00139             // more secure, but it can be VERY slow.
00140             if (!rng) throw exceptions::no_strong_random();
00141         }
00142 
00143         result_type operator()() {
00144             int r=rng.get();
00145             if (r==EOF) throw exceptions::no_strong_random("/dev/urandom "
00146                 "returned EOF");
00147             return static_cast<result_type>(r);
00148         }
00149 
00150         std::ifstream rng;
00151     };
00152 
00153     template <typename T>
00154     BOOST_XINT_INLINE double strong_random_generator_t<T>::entropy() const
00155         { return 8; }
00156 #endif
00157 
00158 template <typename T>
00159 const bool strong_random_generator_t<T>::has_fixed_range = true;
00160 
00161 template <typename T>
00162 const typename strong_random_generator_t<T>::result_type
00163     strong_random_generator_t<T>::min_value =
00164     (std::numeric_limits<typename
00165     strong_random_generator_t<T>::impl_t::result_type>::min)();
00166 
00167 template <typename T>
00168 const typename strong_random_generator_t<T>::result_type
00169     strong_random_generator_t<T>::max_value =
00170     (std::numeric_limits<typename
00171     strong_random_generator_t<T>::impl_t::result_type>::max)();
00172 
00173 template <typename T>
00174 BOOST_XINT_INLINE strong_random_generator_t<T>::strong_random_generator_t():
00175     impl(new impl_t) { }
00176 
00177 template <typename T>
00178 BOOST_XINT_INLINE strong_random_generator_t<T>::~strong_random_generator_t() {
00179     delete impl; }
00180 
00181 template <typename T>
00182 BOOST_XINT_INLINE typename strong_random_generator_t<T>::result_type
00183     strong_random_generator_t<T>::operator()() { return (*impl)(); }
00184 
00185 template <typename T>
00186 BOOST_XINT_INLINE typename strong_random_generator_t<T>::result_type
00187     strong_random_generator_t<T>::min BOOST_PREVENT_MACRO_SUBSTITUTION () const
00188     { return min_value; }
00189 
00190 template <typename T>
00191 BOOST_XINT_INLINE typename strong_random_generator_t<T>::result_type
00192     strong_random_generator_t<T>::max BOOST_PREVENT_MACRO_SUBSTITUTION () const
00193     { return max_value; }
